Java Graphical Library

A library for building simple graphical front ends.

The library provides the ability to draw basic shapes and text as well as to load images onto a window, the drawing surface. It extends Swing functionality supports the use of Swing components, though it is principally designed for creating quick and simple front ends without using more extensive Swing capabilities.

Graphical objects may be moved and rotated once placed in the drawing surface. Opacity of each drawn object is also independently configurable. Mouse clicks on each graphical object can by detected via the use of a callback method.

Beyond working with graphical objects, the library supports several pop-up dialog box styles, including one for text entry and yes/no/cancel operations. Support is also provided for the use of a menu bar through another callback method.

See the documentation for the DrawingSurface class to get started.

There are a set of demonstration applications with source code available. See the us.daveread.edu.graphics.test package documentation for more information.

This documentation covers version 00.05.04

The library may be downloaded from http://bits.monead.com/JavaGuiDevFramework-00.05.04.jar.

The assets used by the demonstration programs may be downloaded from http://bits.monead.com/assets.tar.gz. This file should be expanded at the root of the project where the test programs are being run.

Version History

Version release notes
VersionRelease Notes
00.05.04Added support for setting a dialog type on messages
00.05.02Added support for setting a default input value when using the getUserInput method
00.05.00Now supports switching between DrawingSurface instances
00.04.07Cropping respected on images loaded from classpath
00.04.06Added support for opacity setting on graphical objects
00.04.02Added support for using a menubar as well as slight control over dialog box positioning
00.03.12Made demo programs more visible as demo code and added support for loading images and sounds from the classpath
00.03.02Added subset of Turtle Graphics command support
Packages 
Package Description
us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape
Generic shape (graphical object) operations.
us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.impl
Shapes for the drawing surface.
us.daveread.edu.graphics.surface
Platform for the GUI.
us.daveread.edu.graphics.test
Demonstrations of the GUI framework's capabilities.
us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool
Support for drawing line segments on the drawing surface.
us.daveread.edu.sound
Audio utilities.
us.daveread.edu.utilities
General utility functions.
